content: In the popular board game Monopoly, what are the two most expensive properties on the standard U.S. edition of the game board?

In the standard U.S. edition of the Monopoly board game, the two most expensive properties are Boardwalk and Park Place. Both of these properties are located on the final stretch of the board and are part of the Dark Purple (or Brown, in some editions) property group. Boardwalk costs $400 to purchase, and Park Place costs $350. These properties are highly sought after because they offer the highest rental incomes when developed with houses or hotels.
